oai_dc:dc.dc:title: METHOD OF ESTIMATING THE POWER EXTRACTED BY FIXED COASTAL TYPE WAVE POWER EXTRACTORS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yano, Kenji
Kondo, Hideo
Watabe, Tomiji
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: power extraction
wave power
power estimation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Study is performed on a vertical flap type energy converter, "Pendulor System". The power absorbed with the system in random waves is estimated using a transfer function of absorbed power (absorption coefficient) in regular waves and wave spectrum. A boundary element technique is applied to compute the hydrodynamic problem associated with the system which is placed in regular waves. The applicability of the method has been examined by a series of field test at a test plant caisson. The agreement between estimation and experiment was found to be good except near the resonance frequency of the system.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 20 (1986): Proceedings of 20th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Taipei, Taiwan, 1986.; 176
